metadata.title: USN-3276-2 -- shadow regression
metadata.description: USN-3276-1 intended to fix a vulnerability in su. The solution introduced a regression in su signal handling. This update modifies the security fix. We apologize for the inconvenience.  Original advisory details:   Sebastian Krahmer discovered integer overflows in shadow utilities.  A local attacker could possibly cause them to crash or potentially  gain privileges via crafted input. (CVE-2016-6252)   Tobias St√∂ckmann discovered a race condition in su. A local  attacker could cause su to send SIGKILL to other processes with  root privileges. (CVE-2017-2616)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3276-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  passwd - 1:4.2-3.1ubuntu5.3 login - 1:4.2-3.1ubuntu5.3 uidmap - 1:4.2-3.1ubuntu5.3 No subscription required
